titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Picturesque Palestine, Sinai, and Egypt / ed. by Colonel Wilson ... assisted by the most eminent Palestine explorers, etc. With numerous engravings on steel and wood from original drawings by Harry Fenn and J. D. Woodward.

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created from MARC record by Dallas Pillen
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English

did.unittitle: Picturesque Palestine, Sinai, and Egypt / ed. by Colonel Wilson ... assisted by the most eminent Palestine explorers, etc. With numerous engravings on steel and wood from original drawings by Harry Fenn and J. D. Woodward.

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: BHL: Bentley Historical Library's copy from the library of Rev. Henry Horatio Northrop.

odd.head: Publication, Distribution, Etc.
odd.p: New York : D. Appleton and Co., [1881-81]

odd.head: Formatted Contents Note
odd.p: v. 1. Introduction. By the Very Rev. Dean Stanley.--Jerusalem. By Col. Wilson.--Bethlehem and the north of Judea. By the Rev. Canon Tristram.--The mountains of Judah and Ephraim. By Lieut. Conder.--Samaria and Plain of Esdraelon. by Miss M.E. Rogers.--Esdraelon and Nazareth. by the Rev. Canon Tristram.--Galilee. Northern Galilee. Cæsarea Philippi and the highlands of Galilee. Mount Hermon and its temples. By the Rev. Dr. S. Merrill.--Demascus. By the Rev. Dr. P. Schaff.--Palmyra. The Wady Barada. Baʼalbek. By the Rev. S. Jessup. v. 2. Phœnicia and Lebanon. By the Rev. H.W. [!] Jessup.--The Phœnician plain. By the Rev. Canon Tristram.--Acre, the key of Palestine. Mount Carmel and the river Kishon. Maritime cities and plains of Palestine. by Miss M.E. Rogers.--Lydda and Ramlech. Philistia. by Lt. col. Warren.--The south country of Judæa. By the Rev. Canon Tritram.--The southern borderland and Dead sea. By Professor Palmer.--Mount Hor and the cliffs of Edom. The convent of St. Catherine. By Miss M.E. Rogers.--Sinai, by the Rev. C.P. Clarke.--The land of Goshen. Cairo. Memphis. Thebes. Edfû and Philæ. By S. Lane-Poole.

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Added t.-p., engraved: Issued in 40 parts.
